title: England's Rugby World Cup 2019 clash with France will stay in Tokyo but could face cancellation
text:
England’s final Pool C game against France will be played in Yokohama on Saturday after plans to move it to Oita 600 miles to the south on Kyushu were cancelled.

A contingency plan to move the game and for it to be potentially played behind closed doors was changed after the Super Typhoon Hagibis, which was headed towards Tokyo, shifted direction.

There were also objections from other quarters as to why games were being relocated as opposed to cancelled as per original tournament regulations.

The tournament rules say that any pool game affected by extreme adverse weather conditions would be cancelled rather than postponed with two points awarded to each side and this eventuality could still hit...
description: England’s final Pool C game against France will be played in Yokohama on Saturday after plans to move it to Oita 600 miles to the south on Kyushu were cancelled.
